DataElement.preferredName: Electrocardiography Diagnostic Procedure QTc Interval Assessment Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the QTc interval was assessed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Electrocardiography Diagnostic Procedure QTc Interval Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relateing to electrocardiography (a procedure which records the electrical current in the heart in the form of a continuous strip graph) and an assessment of the QTc interval (a measure of the time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the heart's electrical cycle, at a standardized heart rate of 60/minute).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: No value exists.:Methods, procedures, and tests performed to diagnose disease, disordered function, or disability.

Concepts.definition: A procedure that displays the electrical activity of the heart.
Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.

Property.preferredDefinition: No value exists.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the QTc interval on electrocardiogram less than or equal to 480 msec (Fridericia correction)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a baseline electrocardiogram completed within 28 days prior to study entry and was the QTc found to be less than or equal to 450 msec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the QTc interval less than or equal to 450 msec at baseline

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a baseline electrocardiogram completed within 28 days prior to study entry and was the QTc found to be less than to 450 msec and without evidence of serious ventricular arrhythmia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Electrocardiogram within 30 days of study entry

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the QTc interval greater than or equal to 450 ms on baseline EKG (electrocardiogram)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a screening QTc interval > 480 milliseconds?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a single QTc > 480 milliseconds?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have QTcF greater than 470ms on two or more time points or other factors that increase the risk of QT prolongation such as family history of long QT syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known family history of long QT syndrome?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Assessments Ind-2 2018320v1.0 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.21 AQT added for ticket request CADSR0001812. ak
